meanings.definition: Infected simultaneously with two or more pathogens.
meanings.sent1: The coinfected patient had both the flu and a cold at the same time.
meanings.sent2: The doctor identified the coinfected individuals in the study who had multiple infections.
meanings.sent3: The coinfected cat seemed to have caught both a mouse and a bird in the same day.
meanings.sent4: The garden was like a coinfected jungle, with various pests attacking the plants all at once.
meanings.sent5: The coinfected computer was struggling with both a virus and malware, slowing it down significantly.

meanings.definition: To infect simultaneously with two or more pathogens.
meanings.sent1: The mosquito can coinfect a person with malaria and dengue fever in one bite.
meanings.sent2: The contaminated water source coinfected the entire village with different diseases.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally coinfected the salad with both vinegar and lemon juice, creating a unique taste.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to coinfect the room with tension and excitement at the same time.
meanings.sent5: The storm managed to coinfect the city with rain and hail, causing chaos on the streets.
